page.title: 07Dixton Farm,Dixton
page.content: Dixton Farm is 2 miles to the east of Gotherington.It spreads over a wide area and not all the fields are next to each other.Mr.Jewer,the farm manager, has supplied us with the following information.The farm is mostly arable. They plant a crop of beans every four years.Altogether the farm covers 760 acres.They regularly spray crops so that they do not get 'chocolate drop' on them.They do have some livestock including 27 sheep. There are three staff including Mr.Jewer. The parts which cannot be farmed on they plant with trees.There are no orchards,however,on this farm. There have been many changes in the last ten years. The biggest change was from sheep and cattle farming to arable farming. Arable farming is easier and more profitable.
